7.title_api: Bus crash victims and families face hardship
7.caption_api: Hockey sticks, messages and other items continue to be added to a memorial at the intersection of a fatal bus crash that killed 16 members of the Humboldt Broncos hockey team last week near Tisdale, Sask. on Saturday, April 14, 2018. The victims of the Humboldt Broncos hockey team bus crash may soon get interim payments from a fundraising campaign that has collected $15.2 million. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Liam Richards

10.title_api: Suzuki’s new job comes with most of the old trappings
10.caption_api: Ichiro Suzuki, special assistant to the chairman of the Seattle Mariners, wears a fake moustache and a hoodie as he sits in the dugout and watches the New York Yankees bat during the first inning of a baseball game on June 21 at Yankee Stadium. Suzuki donned a Bobby Valentine-style disguise and sneaked into the Seattle dugout to watch a bit of the action.
10.desc_api: At precisely the right moment, Ichiro Suzuki bounded through the visitors’ dugout at Camden Yards, headed for a group of celebrating players on the field dressed just like him.

13.title_api: World Cup shows good and bad side of soccer
13.caption_api: Brazil’s Neymar, bottom, challenges for the ball with Mexico’s Edson Alvarez during the round of 16 match between Brazil and Mexico at the 2018 soccer World Cup in the Samara Arena, in Samara, Russia, July 2, 2018. The World Cup in Russia has shown soccer at its best and worst. Stars like Brazil’s Neymar have dazzled with their individual skill but frustrated with their theatrics, making the beautiful game a con game at times. So will a new generation of young Canadian soccer players follow suit? Canadian soccer officials are confident they won’t, saying such bad behaviour is not part of our psyche. THE CANADIAN PRESS/AP, Sergei Grits
13.desc_api: World Cup shows the beautiful game can also be a con game. Is Canada immune?

17.title_api: Angry Bird: Brazil’s World Cup mascot popular with fans
17.caption_api: FILE - In this Tuesday, June 12, 2018 file photo Brazil’s mascot holds a soccer ball as fans cheer Brazil’s Neymar as he leaves a training session in Sochi, Russia. It took an angry-looking bird to get Brazilians hooked on their World Cup mascot. Brazil historically never fully embraced the tradition of mascots in sports, but things changed when the soccer federation _ inspired in part by Chicago Bull’s “Benny the Bull” _ turned its cute-looking “Canary” into a mean figure that represents the fans’ anger following the humiliating home loss at the World Cup four years ago.(AP Photo/Andre Penner, File)
17.desc_api: Angry Bird: Brazil’s World Cup mascot popular with fans

33.title_api: Ticats are winning, despite starting every drive this season from their side of midfield
33.caption_api: Jeremiah Masoli has been named a CFL Top Performer, again.

34.caption_api: Sean Thomas Erlington had his eyes on a big game Friday, and he delivered.

35.title_api: Offence, defence come up big for Ticats in home opener
35.caption_api: Ticat Sean Thomas Erlington fights for yardage during first half action.
35.desc_api: The best defence is a good offence. Especially if that offence has the help of a good defence.

36.title_api: Jeremiah Masoli marches Ticats to hometown win over Bombers
36.caption_api: Bombers running back Andrew Harris grabs Ticat Delvin Breaux’s face mask.
36.desc_api: There is a school of thought in the CFL that says it’s perfectly OK for a defence to give up a bunch of short-range stuff underneath, challenging offences to complete pass after pass to move the ball down the field. Only the elite quarterbacks, the thinking goes, are accurate enough to get it done.

37.title_api: Ray’s injury graphic example of CFL’s graphic reality
37.caption_api: Ricky Ray is taken off the field on a stretcher Saturday. He was injured on a play against the Calgary Stampeders.
37.desc_api: As news of the injury to Toronto Argonauts quarterback Ricky Ray spread across social media on Saturday night, the words of support and offers of prayer came pouring in.

38.title_api: Jeremiah Masoli has put a stranglehold on Ticats starting QB job
38.caption_api: Jeremiah Masoli has stared down and outperformed two of the top quarterbacks, on the road, the first two weeks of the CFL schedule.
38.desc_api: Though it will likely disappoint the I-want-to-see-Johnny crowd, Jeremiah Masoli has put a stranglehold on the Hamilton Tiger-Cats starting quarterback job.

39.title_api: Masoli’s performance Friday should quiet any and all Johnny Manziel talk
39.caption_api: Ticats QB Jeremiah Masoli gets away from Edmonton’s Jake Ceresna during the second half Friday.
39.desc_api: The Eskimos are a good team, one of the best in the West, and Jeremiah Masoli dismantled them, writes Drew Edwards.

43.caption_api: Brazil’s Neymar grimaces in pain after a tackle by Serbia’s Adem Ljajic. It was a world-class performance from a world-class flopper.
43.desc_api: A few random thoughts for National Meteor Watch Day, which is odd since no meteors are supposed to be visible tonight …

44.title_api: Hamilton high school students build 4 beach volleyball courts
44.caption_api: Beach volleyball court built by the students of Hamilton District Christian High School.
44.desc_api: It was during one of the first classes of the year that their teacher threw down a challenge that was slightly different and vastly more ambitious than many — perhaps most — high school assignments. Hamilton District Christian High School students were to asked to conceive, plan and build a project that could be a legacy for the school and the community.

45.title_api: Hamilton Cardinals finally get to play at home in their renovated perch
45.caption_api: Finally, Hamilton shortstop Chris Beer will be turning double plays in his own park.
45.desc_api: On one of the nicest days of the summer so far, there he was deep in the bowels of Bernie Arbour Stadium — until recently, calling them the bowels would be a compliment — scrubbing the grime off some office walls that were in desperate need of it.

46.caption_api: Hamilton’s Isaac Nurse scores in overtime to win Game 1 of the quarter-finals over the Niagara IceDogs. It was a huge goal as Hamilton had struggled all year to score on goalie Steven Dhillon and to beat the IceDogs. The Bulldogs went on to win the series 4-1 with the first three games all going to OT.
46.desc_api: It wasn’t a moment, but a feeling that defined this season for Brandon Saigeon.

47.title_api: Hamilton Bulldogs end season with 4-2 loss to Regina Pats in Memorial Cup semifinal
47.caption_api: OHL Hamilton Bulldogs goalie Kaden Fulcher (33) congratulates Host Regina Pats goalie Max Paddock (33) on his team’s win in the Memorial Cup semifinal in Regina on Friday, May, 25, 2018.
47.desc_api: Their season is over, one game short of their goal.

48.title_api: For players like Ryan Moore, this is final weekend of junior hockey career
48.caption_api: Captain Justin Lemcke looks ahead to his last weekend as a member of the Hamilton Bulldogs during practice before the team’s semifinal against the Regina Pats.
48.desc_api: — He doesn’t like to think about it. The end. But the fact of the matter is this:

49.title_api: Bulldogs face Pats with more bite
49.desc_api: Rematch for berth in Memorial Cup final

50.title_api: For Hamilton Bulldogs, what’s one goal toward ‘the goal’?
50.caption_api: Acadie-Bathurst Titan goalie Evan Fitzpatrick looks in the net after a goal by Hamilton Bulldogs forward Robert Thomas early in the third period of Tuesday’s game in Regina.
50.desc_api: While you were sleeping, the Hamilton Bulldogs were wide awake in Regina waiting to find out if they will be playing in the Memorial Cup final or playing for their lives.
